definition: poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

sentences.english: They don't want to arrive home to a needy mother, she says.
sentences.chinese: 他們不希望回到家來又看到媽媽窮困疲憊。

sentences.english: The severe earthquake killed hundreds of people and left thousands destitute.
sentences.chinese: 強烈的地震使數百人履難，留下數千人窮困無依。

sentences.english: Right now the poor guy is really down and out .
sentences.chinese: 現在，可憐的旦尼爾真是處於窮困潦到的境況。

sentences.english: When you are down and out, there seems no hope at all.
sentences.chinese: 當你窮困潦倒的時候，彷彿已渺無希望。

sentences.english: He had once been famous, a child prodigy, but now he was down and out.
sentences.chinese: 曾是名神童，非常出名，但現在窮困潦倒。

sentences.english: Not poverty is the hardship, but neediness.
sentences.chinese: 不貧窮是很難的，除非窮困。

sentences.english: This dissuades many of the poorer patients from seeking TB treatment at hospitals.
sentences.chinese: 這讓很多窮困的病人不願意在醫院中接受治療。

sentences.english: When you're down and out, remember to keep your head up.
sentences.chinese: 當你窮困潦倒的時候，記得保持昂頭挺胸。

sentences.english: It was locked properly just as the man waited patiently as my embarrbummed spouse struggled to remember the comcompost bisexualnine .
sentences.chinese: 他耐性的等着我那窮困的丈夫設法回想起暗鎖的密碼。

sentences.english: He dropped the gold down the chimney to save face for the impoverished father.
sentences.chinese: 他將黃金扔進煙囪以保留這位窮困的父親的臉面。

sentences.english: Destitute, Dokes fled to the back alleys.
sentences.chinese: 窮困的多克斯逃進了小巷。

sentences.english: Dr Paton wanted to treat people who were blind in poor countries.
sentences.chinese: 帕特博士想要治療那些在窮困國家的盲人。

sentences.english: Taos really wrote his poverty life and countrysides depression.
sentences.chinese: 陶詩真實寫隱後窮困和農村荒涼蕭敗。

sentences.english: It is the same with wretchedness as with everything else.
sentences.chinese: 窮困和其他事物是一樣的。

sentences.english: The man seemed poor, but he was respectably dressed.
sentences.chinese: 那個男人看似窮困，卻又衣着體面。

definition: to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
unable to go to school/an interruption to one's education
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
